title: AWS Academy Cloud Foundation Quiz Database

questions.question: What are the advantages of cloud computing over computing on-premises?
What is the pricing model that enables AWS customers to pay for resources on an as-needed basis?
Which of these is not a cloud deployment?
True or False? AWS owns and maintains the network-connected hardware required for application services, while you provision and use what you need.
Which of these is not a benefit of cloud computing over on-premises computing?
options: Trade capital expense for variable expense
Benefit from massive economies of scale
Pay for racking, stacking, and powering services
correct_answers: Pay for racking, stacking, and powering services

questions.question: Which of the following are not benefits of AWS Cloud computing?
Which of the following is a compute service? (Select the best answer)

True or False? Cloud Computing provides a simple way to access servers, storage, databases, and a broad set of application services over the internet. You own the network-connected hardware required for these services and Amazon Web Services provisions what you need.
Economics of Scale result from_______
options: having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in cloud
correct_answers: having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in cloud

questions.question: For certain services like Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS), you can invest in reserved capacity. What options are available for Reserved Instances?
Where can a customer go to get more details about Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) billing activity that took the place 3 months ago?
True or false? To receive the discounted rate associated with Reserved Instances, you must make a full, upfront payment for the term of the agreement
There is no charge for which of the following?
options: Data transfer between services within the same AWS Region
correct_answers: Data transfer between services within the same AWS Region

questions.question: What are the four support plans offered by AWS Support?
What AWS tool compares the cost of running your application in an on-premises data center to AWS?
As AWS grows, the cost of doing business is reduced and savings are passed back to the customer with lower pricing. What is this optimization called?
True or false? AWS offers a variety of services at no charge (VPC, IAM, etc). However, you might be charged for other AWS services that you use in conjunction with these services
When are free data transfers applicable across AWS?
options: Free inbound data transfer for Amazon Elastic Computer Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances
Free outbound data transfer between AWS services within the same Region
Free outbound data transfer to the internet
Free data transfer between different Regions
correct_answers: Free inbound data transfer for Amazon Elastic Computer Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances
Free outbound data transfer between AWS services within the same Region

questions.question: True of false? Unlimited services are available with the AWS Free Tier to new AWS customers for 12 months following their AWS sign-up date.
Which component of the AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
options: D. Amazon virtual private cloud (Amazon VPC)

questions.question: You can run applications and workloads from a region closer to the end users to ______ latency.
True / False? Networking, storage, compute and databases are examples of service categories that AWS offers.
Which of these statements about Availability Zones is not true?
options: A. Availability Zones are designed for fault isolation
B. Availability Zones are made up of one or more data centers
C. Availability zones are connected to each other using high-speed private links
D. A data center can be used for more than one availability zone
correct_answers: D. A data center can be used for more than one availability zone

questions.question: What is true about Regions (Choose two)
options: 1. They are the physical locations of your customers
2. All regions are located in one specific geographic area
3. A region is a physical location that has multiple availability zones
4. Physical location has multiple availability zones
5. Each region is located in a separate geographic area
correct_answers: 3. A region is a physical location that has multiple availability zones
5. Each region is located in a separate geographic area

questions.question: Which of the following are geographic areas that host two or more Availability Zones?
_____ means the infrastructure has built-in component redundancy and _____ means that resources dynamically adjust to increases or decreases in capacity requirements.
options: D. Elastic and scalable, no human intervention

questions.question: True or False? Availability Zones within a region are connected through low-latency links.
AWS highly recommends provisioning your compute resources across _____ availability zones.
True or False? Edge locations are only located in the same general area as regions.
What is the AWS Shared Security Model?
In the shared responsibility model, which of the following are examples of 'Security in the cloud'? (Choose two)
options: A. Compliance with compute security standards and regulations.
B. Physical security of the facilities in which the service operates.
D. Encryption of the data at rest and data in transit.
correct_answers: D. Encryption of the data at rest and data in transit.

questions.question: Which of the following is the responsibility of AWS under the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: C. Security application access and data.
D. Managing custom Amazon machine images (AMI's).

questions.question: When creating an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy, what are the two types of access that can be granted to a user? (Choose two)
True or false? AWS organizations enables you to consolidate multiple aws accounts so that you centrally manage them.
Which of the following are best practices to secure your account using aws identity and access management? (Choose two)
options: A. Provide users with default administrative privileges.
B. Leave unused and unnecessary users and credentials in place.
C. Manage access to AWS resources.
D. Avoid using IAM groups to grant the same access permissions to multiple users.
correct_answers: C. Manage access to AWS resources.

questions.question: Which of the following should be done by the AWS account root user?
options: B. Integrate with other AWS services.
D. Change the AWS support plan.
correct_answers: D. Change the AWS support plan.

questions.question: After initial login, what does AWS recommend as the best practice for the AWS account root user?
options: A. Delete the AWS account root user.
B. Revoke all permissions on the AWS account root user.
C. Restrict permission on the AWS account root user.
D. Delete the access keys of the AWS account root user.
correct_answers: D. Delete the access keys of the AWS account root user.

questions.question: How would a system administrator add an additional layer of login security to a user's AWS management console?
options: B. Audit AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles.

questions.question: True or false? AWS key management service (AWS KMS) enables you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your AWS resources.
Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS
With Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), what is the smallest size subnet you can have in a VPC?
With Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), what is the maximum size IP address range you can have in a VPC?
You need to allow resources in a private subnet to access the internet. Which of the following must be present to enable this access?
Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS?
options: A. Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC)

questions.question: T/F, Private subnets have direct access to the internet.
Which component of AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency deliver?
options: D. Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC)

questions.question: Which of the following is an optional security control that can be applied at the subnet layer of a VPC?
What happens when you use Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to create a new VPC?
options: A. Three subnets are created by default in one Availability Zone
B. A main route table is created by default
C. Three subnets are created by default: one for each Availability Zone
D. An internet gateway is created by default.
correct_answers: B. A main route table is created by default

questions.question: Which of the following can be used to protect Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances hosted in AWS?

You are a solutions architect who works at a large retail company that is migrating its existing infrastructure to AWS. You recommend that they use a custom VPC. When you create a VPC, you assign it to an IPv4 Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block of 10.0.1.0/24 (which has 256 total IP addresses). How many IP addresses are available?
Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?
options: A. Amazon EC2 Costs are billed on a monthly basis.
B. Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances.
C. Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads.
D. Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.
correct_answers: D. Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.

questions.question: If your project requires monthly reports that iterate through very large amounts of data, which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud EC2 purchasing option should you consider?
What is included in an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
options: A. A template for the root volume for the instance.
B. Launch permissions that control which AWS accounts can use the AMI to launch instances.
C. A block device mapping that specifies the volumes to attach to the instance when it's launched.

questions.question: Which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud EC2 feature ensures your instances will not share a physical host with instances from any other AWS customer?
Which of the following services is a serverless compute service in AWS?
What is the service provided by AWS that enables developers to easily deploy and manage applications in the cloud?
Your web application needs four instances to support steady traffic all of the time. On the last day of the month, the traffic triples. What is the most cost-effective way to handle this pattern?
options: A. Run 12 reserved instances all of the time.
B. Run four On-demand Instances constantly, then add eight more On-Demand on the last day of each month.
C. Run four Reserved Instances constantly, then add eight On-Demand Instances on the last day of each month.
D. Run four On-Demand Instances constantly, then add eight Reserved Instances on the last day of each month.
correct_answers: C. Run four Reserved Instances constantly, then add eight On-Demand Instances on the last day of each month.

questions.question: True or false? Containers contain an entire operating system.
Which Amazon EC2 option is best for long-term workload with predictable usage patterns?
Which of the following must be specified when launching a new Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute EC2 windows instance? (Choose two).
options: C. The Amazon EC2 Instance ID.
D. Password for the administrator account.

questions.question: True or false. Amazon simple storage service S3 is an object storage suitable for the storage of flat files like Microsoft Word documents, photos, etc.
Amazon S3 replicates all objects _____.
options: A. On multiple volumes within an availability zone.
B. In multiple Availability zones within the same region.
C. Across multiple regions for higher durability.
correct_answers: B. In multiple Availability zones within the same region.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used as a storage class for an S3 object lifecycle policy? (Choose three)
The name of an S3 bucket must be unique.
options: A. Worldwide across all AWS accounts.
C. Across all your AWS accounts.
correct_answers: A. Worldwide across all AWS accounts.

questions.question: You can use amazon elastic file system efc to:
options: A. Provide simple, scalable, elastic file storage for use only within AWS.
B. Implement storage for Amazon EC2 instances that multiple virtual machines can access at the same time.
C. Host a robust CDN to deliver entire web sites with dynamic, static, and streaming content.
correct_answers: B. Implement storage for Amazon EC2 instances that multiple virtual machines can access at the same time.

questions.question: Amazon Elastic Block Storage (Amazon EBS) is recommended when data _____ and ______ (Choose two).
options: B. Must be quickly accessbile, requiring long-term persistence.
D. Needs to be stored in a different availability zone than the one the EC2 instance is in.
correct_answers: B. Must be quickly accessbile, requiring long-term persistence.

questions.question: True or false, by default all data stored in amazon S3 is viewable by the public.
Regarding amazon S3 glacier, what is a vault?
options: A. The rules that determine who may (or may not) access archives.
B. An object (photos, videos, files, or documents).
C. A container for storing archives.
D. A policy that identifies who can access content stored in Glacier.
correct_answers: C. A container for storing archives.

questions.question: True or false. When you create a bucket in amazon S3, it is associated with a specific aws region.
Which of the following are features of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS). (Choose two).
options: A. Data on an Amazon EBS volume is lost when the attatched instance is stopped.
B. Amazon EBS volumes can be encrypted transparently to workloads on the attached instance.
C. Amazon EBS data is automatically backed up to tape.
D. Data stored on Amazon EBS is automatically replicated within an Availability Zone.
correct_answers: B. Amazon EBS volumes can be encrypted transparently to workloads on the attached instance.
D. Data stored on Amazon EBS is automatically replicated within an Availability Zone.

questions.question: You are designing an ecommerce web application that will scale to hundreds of thousands of concurrent users, Which database technology is best suited to hold the session state in this example?
options: A. Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)

questions.question: You need to find an item in Amazon DynamoDB table using an attribute other than item's primary key. Which of the following operations should you use?
In Amazon DynamoDB, what does the query operation enable you to do?
options: A. Query a table using the Partition Key and optional sort key filter
B. Query and secondary indexes that exists for a table
C. Efficiency retrieve items from a table or secondary index

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud service is best suited for analyzing your data by using standard structured query language (SQL) and your existing business intelligence (BI) tools
options: B. Amazon Simple Storage Simple Glacier

questions.question: In Amazon DynamoDB, an attribute is________.
Which of the following use cases is appropriate for using Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?
options: B. Simple Gets or Put Requests

questions.question: A company has an application, which consists of a .NET layer that connects to a MySQL database. They want to move this application on to AWS and use AWS features such as high availability and automated backups. Which of the following would be an ideal database for this use case
If you are developing an application that requires a database with extremely fast performance, fast scalability, and flexibility in the database schema, which service would you consider?
True of false? Amazon RDS automatically patches the database software and backs up your database, storing the backups for a user-defined retention period and enabling point-in-time recovery
What should you consider when choosing database type?
Which of the following is not one of the four areas of the Performance Efficiency pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
Which of the following is a principle when designing cloud-based systems?
options: B. Make infrequent , large batch changes
D. Use as many services as possible

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose three)
Which design principles are recommended when considering performance efficiency? (Choose 2)
AWS Trusted Advisor provides insight regarding which five categories of an AWS account?
options: A. Performance, cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, service limits.
B. Security, Fault tolerance, high availability, connectivity, service limits
C. Performance, cost optimization, access control, connectivity, security
D. Security, access control, high availability, performance, service limits
correct_answers: A. Performance, cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, service limits.

questions.question: What is the focus of the sustainability pillar of the well - architected Frame work ?
options: A. Designing workloads that recover quickly from failures.
B. Minimize the environmental impacts of the running cloud networks.
C. Avoid unnecessary cost in cloud networks.
D. Automating updates to cloud networks.
correct_answers: B. Minimize the environmental impacts of the running cloud networks.

questions.question: The AWS Well-Architected Framework is organized into how many pillars?
After you move to the AWS Cloud, you want to ensure that the right security settings are put in place. Which online tool can assist in security compliance?
Which of the following is a measure of your system's ability to provide functionality when desired by the user?
What is defined as the ability for a system to remain operational even if some of the components of that system fail?
Which of the following best describes a system that can withstand some measures of degradation, experiences minimal downtime, and requires minimal human intervention
Which of the following AWS tools help your application scale up or down based on demand? (Choose two)
Which service would you use to send alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
options: A. Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)
correct_answers: A. Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling? ( Choose three )
options: B. Responds to changing conditions by adding or terminating instances
D. Launches instances from a specified Amazon Machine Image (AMI)
E. Enforces a minimum number of running Amazon EC2 instances
correct_answers: B. Responds to changing conditions by adding or terminating instances
D. Launches instances from a specified Amazon Machine Image (AMI)
E. Enforces a minimum number of running Amazon EC2 instances

questions.question: Which of the following must be configured on an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to expect incoming traffic ?
Which of the following elements are used to create an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration? (Choose three)
options: D. Virtual Private Cloud (VPC ) and Subnets
E. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes
correct_answers: E. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes

questions.question: Which of the following services can help you collect important metrics from Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances?
Which of the following are elements of an Auto Scaling group ? (Choose three)
There is an audit at your company and they need to have a big log of all access to AWS resources in the account. Which of the following services can assist in providing these details?
options: C. Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
D. Amazon Simple Notification Service ( Amazon SNS)

questions.question: In Elastic Load Balancing, when the load balancing detects an unhealthy target, which of the following are true (Choose three)
options: A. Stops routing traffic to that target
C. Resumes routing traffic when it detects that the target is healthy again
D. Resumes routing traffic when manually restarted
E. Routes traffic to a healthy target
correct_answers: A. Stops routing traffic to that target
C. Resumes routing traffic when it detects that the target is healthy again
E. Routes traffic to a healthy target
